text:
ected by homocystinuria ?,"The most common form of homocystinuria affects at least 1 in 200,000 to 335,000 people worldwide. The disorder appears to be more common in some countries, such as Ireland (1 in 65,000), Germany (1 in 17,800), Norway (1 in 6,400), and Qatar (1 in 1,800). The rarer forms of homocystinuria each have a small number of cases reported in the scientific literature.",GHR,homocystinuria
What are the genetic changes related to homocystinuria ?,"Mutations in the CBS, MTHFR, MTR,
